header.p: Castor is the shortest path between Java[tm] objects, XML documents, SQL tables and LDAP directories. It provides Java to XML binding, Java to SQL/LDAP persistence, and then some more.

p.a: About the origins of the name

section.title: Features
section.p:
Short feature list (we haven't got all day):
Castor XML: Java object to XML document
Castor JDO: Java object persistence on top of RDBMS
Castor DAX: Java object persistence on top of LDAP
Castor DSML: LDAP directory exchange through XML
XML-based mapping file specify the mapping between one model and another
Support for schema-less Java to XML binding
In memory caching and write-at-commit reduces JDBC operations
Two phase commit transactions, object rollback and deadlock detection
OQL query mapping to SQL queries
EJB container managed persistence provider for OpenEJB
See the status page for more information.

section.title: About the Castor Project
section.p: The Castor project has been developed out of need: the need to get stuff done and the need to write useful code. It has been designed and coded over many cups of Latte and tall Americano, as proof that coffe beans do come in handy.
